result.execSummary:
The defendant Krystal M Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 04/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Krystal M Howard
Current: 331 W Main St, Apt.304, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 06-17-2016)
Prior: 292 W. Main Street #204, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant Krystal M Howard in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count #1 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $267.50 -to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 4/1/16, alternate 5 days jail if not paid.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Krystal M Howard in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Menden requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Krystal M Howard in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjourned date so Defendant can complete community service and accept the state's offer.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Krystal M Howard did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attonrey Menden requests an adjourmment so Defendant can complete community service.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
to appear filed by Atorney Eryn Menden

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Krystal M Howard did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mended requests an adjournment - Defendant is enrolled in treatment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
